reviews.review: I was not expecting to be impressed with a game that's frankly very old. I bought this about a year ago, because  Steam was practically giving it away, and I thought that at some point I would give it a try between play more modern games and see what all the hype was about. On the surface it looks like an old first person shooter involving Aliens... Cool, never seen that before. *Sarcasm* But then I transported myself back to 2004. A time when getting a college degree meant something, a time when you didn't need to be a millionaire to own a regular 3 bedroom, and a time when all the good video games really only came out on consoles. While the graphics aren't amazing by today's standards, they are better than some games that came out much later, and in some areas hold up very well, especially in the Citadel where it felt comparable the Mass Effect trilogy. The mechanics work very well and make the game very fun. As the game progressed, i started seeing what made this such a big deal and how future games of the genre took so much influence from this. Everything starts out with you as the player having really no idea what is going on, and then you begin understanding the stakes at hand, and then you make it into the Citadel... that was a very rewarding holy hell moment. The game takes  on a completely different feel, almost uncanny and disturbing, but you also feel like a god with the upgraded gravity gun. While I felt chills at the end of this game (maybe from the brownie I ate), I can imagine how much more rewarding this game was back in 2004 when players made it to the end credits. For me, as the credits rolled, I forgot that Half-Life 2 was an old game, which is very high praise. Most older games that make me nostalgic are terrible such as Oblivion, or unplayable like Goldeneye on the N64.  My only true gripe is how the Xbox controller would sometimes have a mind of its own, leading to me to disconnect and reconnect and reset the controller functions or sometimes just restart the game entirely. Examples, are the trigger buttons being stuck on constant fire and the joysticks no longer working, and no its not the controller, it works fine on everything else. If you're a heretic like me and do not like keyboard and mouse, that can be quite annoying. Other than that small grip I highly recommend Half-Life 2.

I missed this game in my younger year (I blame Pokemon), Steam gave me the opportunity to finish it as an adult. 

Even though I think this game only gives you a full world-forgetting immersion feeling in the last chapter, the game is well made in terms of linear level progression. I am used to games with more lore building but for a game this age, it does all it can. 

Puzzles that are a challenge even after so many years gets this game a place in my fond memories.

Yet:
The only thing that I disliked with a passion was driving the airboat and the buggy and still trying to find my way through the levels and shooting enemies. Something to remember when playing newer released games with vehicles.
smooth engaging cool game totally worth

This game was definitely something different when I played it. I am not done playing it as of writing, so I cannot give out any spoilers.

I initially wrote this review with the idea that it was impossible to determine what you were supposed to do next. I have spent a good amount of time staring at different things and exploring the level I was on because I had no idea what I was supposed to do to advance to the next level. It has been genuinely frustrating at times. However, I realize now that this is not bad storytelling, it's simply a clever challenge that I happen to be bad at.

Keep in mind that this is the sequel to Half-Life 1 (including "Half-Life" and "Half-Life Source", they are different builds of the same story). You will not have nearly as much fun in this game if you have not already played one of those other games.

If you want to try your hand at not getting confused at what to do, then go for it. In my opinion, this game would have a much easier flow and be more fun to play if that wasn't a problem. But every time I put that game down I feel like I am doing it because I am stuck on a particular level.

amazing story and gameplay, a real classic

At first I only bought the game, because my girlfriend told me how good it was. After playing at it the first time, I thought it was garbage, but after giving a full try a few months later, I instantly regretted not jumping in sooner. For it's age the graphics still hold up well. The voice acting is excellent, and the story is indeed immaculate, intriguing and spell binding. This is honestly one of the most exhilarating action FPS I've ever heard. WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR??!!

The sequel to Half-Life. This game is incredible, I've always imagined the Half-Life series to be games that have changed the way video games work forever. This game was, in my mind, the first game that incorporated a first person shooter, a story, characters and physics objects. Valve is one of, if not, the best video game developers of all time.
Likely to be the best follow up game ever made. Excellent story telling and set pieces.
